result.execSummary:
The defendant Davashia L Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08/21/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample, if not already provided; pay the surcharge. Due financial hardship, Court waives all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, except for any mandatory cost or surcharges. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Court ordered that the defndant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he may never possess a firearm.

- Successfully complete Anger Management, and continued programming.
- Successfully complete a parenting class.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
- No illegal substances.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victims rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Defendant to not use corporal punishment or any object to discipline her children.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
-  Obtain/maintain employment.
- Work toward GED/HSED.

timeConds.notes:
01-22-16/ Judge Janet Protasiewicz
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 40 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC. 
**  **  **  **  **  **  **  
01-26-16/ Correction to clerical entry error on 01-22-2016 order:
Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC.


STAYED pending a review on 08-21-15

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davashia L Porter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Corrected entry; Court imposed 60 days condition time (not 40 days).
Reflects 01-22-16 Court order imposing 40 days of condition time

Defendant Davashia L Porter in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 60 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed. No further review.

Defendant Davashia L Porter in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davashia L Porter in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davashia L Porter in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

  Defendant sentenced to serve 12 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015. 
-Successfully complete Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-No illegal substances.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victims rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to not use corporal punishment or any object to discipline her children.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waives all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, except for any mandatory cost or surcharges.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Work toward GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided; pay the surcharge.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

Received and filed: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Davashia L Porter in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter here for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.  Defendant is not compliant and has a few open cases in other counties.  On motion of the state, Court ordered the agreement revoked and a judgment of conviction be entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davashia L Porter in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Review hearing held.  Defendant has new felony cases in another county.  Defendant denies it is her and Court granted request for adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Review hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davashia L Porter in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Wiaver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  
The Court reviewed the Intake Requirement and Further Conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended for a period of twelve months.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  The 8/27/14 jury trial is vacated.  Review hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davashia L Porter in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court modified the no contact order to a no violent contact order.

Defendant Davashia L Porter in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with G.P. 1/29/2008 D.O.B. unless the contact is approved by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare if Bureau is involved.

Defendant Davashia L Porter in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5-20-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
